intro: Campanula bononiensis subsp. simplex, commonly known as the simple bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces upright spikes of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in early summer. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of garden conditions.
